From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To enable the logging of configuration changes, use the **logging enable** command in configuration change logger configuration mode. To disable the logging of configuration changes, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: The following example shows how to enable configuration logging:
The following example shows how to clear the configuration log by disabling and then reenabling the configuration log:
ExtraInfo: Use this command if you want to log configuration changes. If you disable configuration logging, all configuration log records that were collected are purged.

RelatedCmds.description: Suppresses the display of password information in configuration log files.
Enters configuration change logger configuration mode.
Specifies the maximum number of entries retained in the configuration log.
Enables the sending of notifications of configuration changes to a remote syslog.
Displays entries from the configuration log.
